caption:
This photograph depicts a wedding scene with three individuals dressed in formal attire. On the left, there is a young man wearing a dark suit with a ruffled white shirt and a large bow tie; a white flower boutonniere is affixed to his lapel. In the center is a young woman wearing a traditional white wedding gown and a long, flowing veil attached to a lace headpiece; she is holding a colorful bouquet of flowers featuring yellow, red, and orange blooms. To the right, another young woman is seen wearing a dark dress with a white lace collar and cuffs, complemented by a broad-brimmed white hat with black and green ribbon bands. The trio is engaged in what appears to be a intimate moment, with the bride looking at her bouquet and the others leaning in slightly towards her, suggesting they are perhaps commenting on the flowers or engaging in a light, private conversation.

The background of the scene is softly focused, featuring neutral and warm tones that suggest the setting could be indoors, possibly a hallway or a room with minimal decoration, focusing the viewer's attention on the subjects and their interaction. The overall mood conveys a sense of gentle celebration and personal connection among the group.
title: The bride and groom and a member of the wedding party with a bouquet at New Ulm, Minnesota. Following a church ceremony the couple hosted a wedding dance in the evening at the Turner Club Gymnasium. New Ulm is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota. It was founded in 1854 by a German immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from Europe. Town growth has been helped with the arrival of manufacturing firms.
